project.name: Atlas Mobile
project.scope: Cross-platform app, feature flags, offline sync

sections.title: Project Context & UX Role
sections.goal: Establish the UX lead’s responsibilities and constraints within the Atlas Mobile pilot, including interactions with other departments and policy adherence.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through your primary responsibilities on Atlas Mobile during the pilot phase?
How do you ensure UX decisions align with Novereon’s values like 'Safety First' and 'Sustainable Velocity'?
What interdependencies exist between your UX team and the Mobile or Platform departments?

sections.title: Design System & Accessibility
sections.goal: Explore how the design system (DS-ATLAS v2) supports accessibility and consistent user experience across platforms.
sample_questions: How does DS-ATLAS v2 address cross-platform consistency for critical workflows?
What accessibility standards are you targeting, and how are they validated?
Have you encountered any conflicts between design system constraints and feature velocity?

sections.title: Offline Sync & Feature Flags
sections.goal: Investigate technical and UX considerations for offline sync and feature flag integration, including failure modes and user feedback loops.
sample_questions: How do offline sync mechanisms influence the UX for intermittent connectivity scenarios?
Can you describe a case where a feature flag rollout impacted user perception?
What’s your process for collaborating with SRE and QA teams when sync issues arise?

sections.title: Cross-Department Collaboration & Risk Management
sections.goal: Understand how UX integrates with QA, Security, and SRE for risk-based testing and incident response in the pilot.
sample_questions: How do you contribute to runbooks like RB-MOB-021 Crash Loop Mitigation from a UX perspective?
Have you been involved in applying policy POL-QA-014 Risk-Based Testing & Traceability to Atlas Mobile?
What’s the escalation path when a UX-related defect is found in production?

sections.title: Strategic Decisions & Trade-offs
sections.goal: Discuss how the UX lead and CTO balance innovation with stability, referencing concrete artifacts and metrics.
sample_questions: Can you share an example of a trade-off between rapid feature delivery and maintaining UX quality?
How do SLA commitments, if any, shape UX design priorities?
What evidence or metrics do you rely on when deciding to pivot a UX approach mid-pilot?
